description: Describes the specified EC2 Instance Connect Endpoints or all EC2 Instance Connect Endpoints.

parameters.name: Filters
parameters.description: One or more filters. instance-connect-endpoint-id - The ID of the EC2 Instance Connect Endpoint. state - The state of the EC2 Instance Connect Endpoint ( create-in-progress | create-complete | create-failed | delete-in-progress | delete-complete | delete-failed). subnet-id - The ID of the subnet in which the EC2 Instance Connect Endpoint was created. tag:<key> - The key/value combination of a tag assigned to the resource. Use the tag key in the filter name and the tag value as the filter value. For example, to find all resources that have a tag with the key Owner and the value TeamA, specify tag:Owner for the filter name and TeamA for the filter value. tag-key - The key of a tag assigned to the resource. Use this filter to find all resources assigned a tag with a specific key, regardless of the tag value. tag-value - The value of a tag assigned to the resource. Use this filter to find all resources that have a tag with a specific value, regardless of tag key. vpc-id - The ID of the VPC in which the EC2 Instance Connect Endpoint was created. (dict) --- A filter name and value pair that is used to return a more specific list of results from a describe operation. Filters can be used to match a set of resources by specific criteria, such as tags, attributes, or IDs. If you specify multiple filters, the filters are joined with an AND, and the request returns only results that match all of the specified filters. For more information, see List and filter using the CLI and API in the Amazon EC2 User Guide. Name (string) --- The name of the filter. Filter names are case-sensitive. Values (list) --- The filter values. Filter values are case-sensitive. If you specify multiple values for a filter, the values are joined with an OR, and the request returns all results that match any of the specified values. (string) ---

parameters.name: InstanceConnectEndpointIds
parameters.description: One or more EC2 Instance Connect Endpoint IDs. (string) ---

nested_items.name: InstanceConnectEndpoints
nested_items.description: Information about the EC2 Instance Connect Endpoints.

nested_items.name: OwnerId
nested_items.description: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that created the EC2 Instance Connect Endpoint.

nested_items.name: InstanceConnectEndpointId
nested_items.description: The ID of the EC2 Instance Connect Endpoint.

nested_items.name: InstanceConnectEndpointArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the EC2 Instance Connect Endpoint.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: The current state of the EC2 Instance Connect Endpoint.

nested_items.name: StateMessage
nested_items.description: The message for the current state of the EC2 Instance Connect Endpoint. Can include a failure message.

nested_items.name: DnsName
nested_items.description: The DNS name of the EC2 Instance Connect Endpoint.

nested_items.name: NetworkInterfaceIds
nested_items.description: The ID of the elastic network interface that Amazon EC2 automatically created when creating the EC2 Instance Connect Endpoint.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: VpcId
nested_items.description: The ID of the VPC in which the EC2 Instance Connect Endpoint was created.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZone
nested_items.description: The Availability Zone of the EC2 Instance Connect Endpoint.

nested_items.name: CreatedAt
nested_items.description: The date and time that the EC2 Instance Connect Endpoint was created.

nested_items.name: SubnetId
nested_items.description: The ID of the subnet in which the EC2 Instance Connect Endpoint was created.

nested_items.name: PreserveClientIp
nested_items.description: Indicates whether your client's IP address is preserved as the source. The value is true or false.
If true, your client's IP address is used when you connect to a resource.
If false, the elastic network interface IP address is used when you connect to a resource.

nested_items.name: SecurityGroupIds
nested_items.description: The security groups associated with the endpoint. If you didn't specify a security group, the default security group for your VPC is associated with the endpoint.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: The tags assigned to the EC2 Instance Connect Endpoint.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The key of the tag.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value of the tag.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: The token to include in another request to get the next page of items. This value is null when there are no more items to return.
